Body.Content:
We’re updating the default background image on Microsoft Entra sign-in screens for Work or School accounts. This visual refresh is designed to reduce distractions, improve focus during sign-in, and align with Microsoft’s modern Fluent design language, creating a more consistent and trusted authentication experience across Microsoft services.

When this will happen:

General Availability (Worldwide, GCC, GCCH, and DoD): We will begin rolling out late September 2025 and expect to complete by early October 2025.

How this will affect your organization:

This is a visual-only interface update and does not impact sign-in functionality. The new background will appear only on screens where company branding is not configured or where users are directed to a default sign-in experience. 

Tenants without a custom background configured:

    • The new background will appear on all authentication screens.

    Tenants with a custom background configured:

    • No change will be seen where a tenant ID or domain hint is present in the URL.
    • The new background may appear when users access login.microsoftonline.com without a domain hint or custom URL.

    Entra External ID tenants: 

    • No changes will be applied.

    Current default background image

    New default background image

    What you need to do to prepare:

    No action is required. The update will be applied automatically.

    We recommend updating internal documentation and notifying your help desk to reduce potential confusion.

    To change the default background, consider configuring a custom background image via company branding. If you have configured a custom background image in company branding for your tenant, there will be no change for your users.

    Admin controls screenshot for uploading a custom background in company branding settings:

    Learn more:
